result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachariah H. Reynolds

defendant.name: Reynolds, Zachariah H.
defendant.address: 1430 N. Torun Road, #335, Stevens Point, WI 54482

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:49 a.m. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM410, 15CM496, 15CM497, and 15CM503 are heard today.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM410 Ct 1: No Contest
15CM410 Ct 2: No Contest
15CM496: No Contest
15CM503 Ct 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM410 Ct 1 & 2; 15CM496; & 15CM503 Ct 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CM497 and 15CM503 ct 1 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court requesting on the jail sentences that he be allowed huber, but no electronic monitor. 
Atty Halverson concurs in part with the joint recommendation, but requests not to impose jail on 15CM496 or let him have huber w/electronic monitor for treatment. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:******PROBATION****
15CM410 Ct 1: 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct - Misd: 
I/S Sentence: 24 mo Probation
9 mo jail - stayed (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)
39 days credit
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as listed in 15CM503.

15CM410 Ct 2: 946.41(1) Resist/Obstruct - Misd:
I/S Sentence: 24 mo Probation
9 mo jail - stayed (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)
39 days credit
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CM503.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

15CM496: 946.49(1)(a) Bail Jump-Misd:
Straight jail time of 120 days with 68 days credits. (w/huber, but no electronic monitor)
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.  Pay within 60 days or setup a payment plan.

15CM503 Ct 2: 946.41(1) Resist/Obstruct - Misd:
I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, consecutive (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)  - stayed.
24 mo Probation:
Conditions:
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample, if not done so.
No Contact with Athena Nehls, her residence, or her family.
Submit apology letter for victim to Agent first with in 30day and Agent will forward to victim.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return of Search Warrant for OWI  (Motion and Order of Dismissal is not a part of this case)

Attorney Acalia Halverson in court.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered on all three cases.
15CM496 $1,000 sig bond: Comply with all other conditions.
15CM497Continued.
15CM503 $1,000 sig bond: Comply with all other condtions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Blood Search Warant, Affidavit in Support of Blood Search Warrant

Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CM410. 
In addition to PTSP:  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *14 times per week.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Acalia Halverson appears in Court.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes bond arguments to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  12/14/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
